pullRequest.body:
As discussed at
https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/116395-maths/topic/Second.20Derivative.20Test

PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

nodes.body:
### PR summary [4b2a20eed3](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/16351/commits/4b2a20eed37e6ea0e04d871f36a4dcaf1f76ecd0)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
| `Mathlib.Topology.Order.OrderClosedExtr`|660|
| `Mathlib.Analysis.Calculus.FirstDerivativeTest`|1577|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ deriv_neg_nonneg`
`+ deriv_neg_nonpos`
`+ first_derivative_test_Ioo_max`
`+ first_derivative_test_Ioo_min`
`+ first_derivative_test_max`
`+ first_derivative_test_max₀`
`+ isLocalMax_of_mono_anti'.{u,`
`+ isLocalMax_of_mono_anti.{u,`
`+ isLocalMin_of_anti_mono'.{u,`
`+ isLocalMin_of_anti_mono.{u,`
`+ nhdsWithin_Iio_of_punctured`
`+ nhdsWithin_Ioi_of_punctured`
`+ nhdsWithin_punctured_of_Iio_Ioi`
`+ nhds_of_Ici_Iic.{u}`
`+ union_mem_nhds_of_mem_nhdsWithin.{u}`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>
Because of the merge conflict I am closing this one and starting a new one
I don't think that we need a separate lemma for `hd₀.differentiableAt (isOpen_Ioo.mem_nhds hab)`.
lol... OK, I've deleted it (it was only used in an already deleted lemma)
The name is too generic and doesn't mention derivatives at all.
Indeed, now I'm thinking there is no need for this to be a lemma. Converted to just a "have" statement.
It's enough to assume that `f` is continuous at `b` and is continuous on `Ioo`, no need to talk about differentiability.
Indeed, now I'm thinking there is no need for this to be a lemma. Converted to just a "have" statement.
Great! Using that, I was able to delete this "theorem" now.
Yes. Since it builds on both `LocalExtr.lean` and `OrderClosed.lean`, I've put it in a new file `OrderClosedExtr.lean`.
Should we assume that `∀ᶠ x in 𝓝[≠] b, DifferentiableAt ℝ f x`, `∀ᶠ x in 𝓝[<] b, deriv f x ≤ 0`, and `∀ᶠ x in 𝓝[>] b, 0 ≤ deriv f x`?
That makes sense. Maybe two versions, `first_derivative_test_max` and `first_derivative_test_max'` since mine is a bit easier to understand?
Now I have added the precise statement you suggested, sorry for the delay.

pullRequest.title: feat: First Derivative Test from calculus
